sponsor: VA Office of Research and Development
briefTitle: Chemotherapy After Prostatectomy (CAP) For High Risk Prostate Carcinoma
officialTitle: CSP #553 - Adjuvant Therapy in Prostate Carcinoma Treatment
summary: VA Cooperative Study #553 is designed to prospectively evaluate the efficacy of early adjuvant chemotherapy using docetaxel and prednisone added to the standard of care for patients who are potentially cured by radical prostatectomy but who are at high risk for relapse. The standard of care is surveillance, with the addition of androgen deprivation at the time of biochemical relapse. This study will assess the effect of adding early chemotherapy to the standard of care on progression free survival in Veterans at high risk for progression after prostatectomy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Progression-Free Survival
